page.title: 09RECREATION - DERWENT VALLEY
page.content: New flora would help to stimulate interest and study. Individuals and organised groups use the Walk for exercise and sponsored functions for charitable funds, whilst the horse riding school at Hagg Farm on the A694 road, and others, often use the route. Several public footpaths cross over and under the Walk opening up the adjacent woods and fields whilst the viaducts give excellent views over the surrounding countryside and the housing development at Hamsterley Mill and Parklands. On the site of the original Lintz Green Station, the station master's house and railway workers' cottages are now private residences. Here the River Derwent and the Walk are very close only 135 almost vertical feet separate them at one point.
